subject: Communication
title: The Duchenne Smile: Real vs. Fake
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Duchenne Smile: Real vs. Fake usable.

hook.text: A politician smiles at a rally. The mouth says joy, but the eyes are empty. Something feels wrong.

buildup.text: French neurologist Guillaume Duchenne discovered in 1862 that genuine smiles involve eye muscles too.

discovery.text: A Duchenne smile crinkles the corners of the eyes. A social smile only lifts the corners of the mouth.

twist.text: About 10% of people can fake a Duchenne smile voluntarily. The rest can't â€” their eyes betray the truth.

climax.text: Studies link genuine Duchenne smiles in yearbook photos to better life outcomes decades later.

punchline.text: The eyes don't lie. They either smile with you or they don't.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a Duchenne smile from a fake one?
